DOC.detailed_description: The propose study randomize , placebo-controlled , triple-blinded , parallel-group clinical trial . Patients recruit neurosurgical population St. Michael 's Hospital . The inclusion criterion : - Adults age 18 year ; - schedule one follow supratentorial craniotomy : 1. resection brain tumour 2. clip un-ruptured cerebral aneurysm 3. excision artero-venous malformation ( AVM ) , 4. removal epileptic focus - ASA physical status < IV Intervention group : scalp nerve block 20 ml bupivacaine 0.5 % + epinephrine 1:200,000 ( divide among different injection site ) end surgery removal endo-tracheal tube . Control group : equal injection 20 ml saline + epinephrine 1:200,000 ( time ) . In study arm , post-operative rescue analgesia provide hydromorphone patient-controlled analgesia ( PCA ) . The primary outcome study 24h post-operative pain score assess visual analogue scale ( VAS ) . Important secondary outcome : - total PCA hydromorphone consumption first 24 48 post-operative hour ; - incidence nausea vomit first 24 48 post-operative hour ; - time reach discharge eligibility PACU/ICU hospital length stay . Patients ask rate pain use VAS 30 min , 1 , 2 , 4 , 8 , 12 , 18 , 24 , 48 h , postoperatively research coordinator/bedside nurse . Pain also assess 5 , 30 60 day postoperatively use Numeric Rating Scale ( 0-10 ) .
